metadata.title: The challenge of emerging and re-emerging infectious diseases

FIGREF0.text: Figure 1: Red represents newly emerging diseases; blue, re-emerging/resurging diseases; black, a ‘deliberately emerging’ disease. Adapted, with permission, from ref. 23.

FIGREF1.text: Figure 2: About 15 million (>25%) of 57 million annual deaths worldwide are the direct result of infectious disease. Figures published by the World Health Organization (see http://www.who.int/whr/en and ref. 7).

FIGREF2.text: Figure 3: Cases are given by country. SARS-related deaths are indicated in parentheses. A total of 8,096 cases (and 774 deaths) are presented. Figures published by the World Health Organization (see http://www.who.int/csr/sars/country/en).

FIGREF3.text: Figure 4: Sporadic cases of mild human illness associated with avian influenza viruses were reported before 1997. See http://www.who.int/csr/disease/influenza/en and ref. 76.
